events.eventSummary: A new trend in crypto scam involves individuals posing as police to steal millions. Sources: https://beincrypto.com/crypto-scammers-impersonate-police-officers/

The Washington Post is notifying nearly 10,000 employees and contractors that some of their personal and financial data has been exposed in the Oracle data theft attack. Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/bleepingcomputer.com/post/3m5jjy7tcus2b

events.entities: Fundidora de Cananea S.A. de C.V. (FUCASA)
events.eventSummary: Qillin hacking group claims to have breached Fundidora de Cananea S.A. de C.V. (FUCASA). Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jiwdh7rp25
Coinbase Cartel hacking group claims to have breached PACCAR. Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jdhpkodn2f
Coinbase Cartel hacking group claims to have breached Cinvestav (Centro de Investigación y de Estudios Avanzados). Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jdxfq4v32d

dailyBrief: Today's cyber threat landscape is highly active, marked by multiple high-impact incidents. Notably, a new crypto scam trend involves impersonation of law enforcement to steal millions, signaling a sophisticated escalation in fraud tactics. The Washington Post has reported a major data breach affecting thousands of employees, indicating significant risk to personal and financial information. Additionally, a series of breaches claimed by hacking groups targeted organizations such as FUCASA, PACCAR, and Cinvestav, underscoring persistent threats from organized cybercriminals. The day’s events reflect an elevated risk level, with both high-profile scams and data breaches driving a high overall threat score.
